lines.content: **BSS Task Manager** is a simple **Command Line Interface (CLI) task manager** that allows users to manage their tasks efficiently.
Users can **add, delete, mark, unmark, and find tasks**, while the application **automatically saves** all changes.
1. **Ensure you have Java 17 or later installed** on your computer.
3. **Move the JAR file** to your desired working directory.
4. **Open a command terminal**, navigate to the folder, and run:
Adds a simple task without a deadline.
Adds an event with a deadline.
Adds an event with a start and end time.
Displays all tasks currently in the task list.
Finds tasks that contain a specific keyword.
Deletes a specific task from the list.
Ends the session, closes the chatbot.
Current task list will be saved automatically and restored upon next session.
**1. How do I quickly reset my task list?**
Delete the `[JAR file location]/data/duke.txt` file and restart the program on your computer.
Ensure `[JAR file location]/data/duke.txt` exists. If it was accidentally deleted, your data is gone.
**3.  Can I edit the task descriptions?**
Sorry but NO, you must delete and re-add the task with new details.
* The main class that runs the task management application.
* It initialises storage, task list, and the user interface.
* Constructs a new BSS instance, loading stored tasks if available.
* @param filePath The file path to store task data.
* The main entry point of the application.
* All specific commands should extend this class and implement its methods.
* @param tasks   The task list to modify or retrieve data from.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage system to persist data.
* @throws DukeException If the command execution encounters an error.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException;
* Determines whether the command is an exit command.
* @return {@code true} if the command exits the application, otherwise {@code false}.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param args The index of the task to delete.
* @throws DukeException If the task index is invalid.
throw new DukeException("Oops! Please enter a valid task number to delete.");
* Removes the specified task from the task list and updates storage.
* @param tasks   The task list to modify.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage system to persist data.
* @throws DukeException If the task index is out of bounds.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Oops! Invalid task number.");
System.out.println(" Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Handles the execution of the "find" command.
* Searches for tasks in the list that match the given keyword.
* Constructs a CommandFinder with the given search keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* @throws DukeException If the keyword is empty.
throw new DukeException(" Oops! What are you looking for?");
* Executes the "find" command and displays matching tasks.
* @param tasks   The task list to search in.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage system (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println(" Sorry, I can't find matching tasks :(");
System.out.println(" Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Constructs a CommandMarker with the specified task index.
* @param args The index of the task to mark as done.
* @throws DukeException If the index is invalid.
throw new DukeException("Oops! Please enter a valid task number to mark.");
* Marks the specified task as done and updates storage.

* @throws DukeException If the task index is out of bounds.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {

* Constructs a CommandUnmarker with the specified task index.
* @param args The index of the task to unmark.
* @throws DukeException If the index is invalid.
throw new DukeException("Oops! Please enter a valid task number to unmark.");

* Constructs a Deadline task with a description and a due date.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by The due date/time by which the task should be completed.
* Converts the deadline task into a formatted string for file storage.
* @return a string representation of the deadline task suitable for file storage.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task, including its type, status, and due date.
* @return a formatted string representing the deadline task.
* Constructs a DeadlineCommandAdder with the specified task description and due date.
* @param args The full command input by the user, expected in the format: "task description /by due date".
* @throws DukeException If the input format is incorrect.
throw new DukeException("Oops! A deadline must have a description and a due date: deadline <task> /by <date>.");
* Adds a new deadline task to the task list and updates storage.
* @param tasks   The task list where the new deadline task will be added.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println(" Got it! I've added this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");

* @throws DukeException If the input format is incorrect.
throw new DukeException("Oops! An event must have a description, a start time, and an end time: event <task> /from <start> /to <end>.");

Task task = new Event(description, from, to);

* Handles loading tasks from the file and saving tasks to the file.
* Ensures that the storage file and directory exist. If they do not exist, they are created.
* Saves the current list of tasks to the file.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to save.
* Loads tasks from the storage file into an ArrayList.
* @return The list of tasks loaded from the file.
System.out.println("No existing task file found. Start with an empty list.");
* Represents a task in the task list.
* This is an abstract class extended by Todo, Deadline, and Event.
* Constructs a new Task with a description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* "X" means that the task is completed, while " " means the task is incomplete.
* @return "X" if the task is done, otherwise " ".
* Converts the task into a string representation for file storage.
* The format should be overridden by subclasses.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Converts a formatted string into a {@link Task} object.
* The string should be in the format: "Type | Status | Description | (Additional Fields)".
* @param line The formatted string representation of a task.
* @return The corresponding Task object, or {@code null} if the format is incorrect.
if (parts.length < 3) return null; // Ensure at least 3 parts exist
if (parts.length < 4) return null; // Ensure deadline has date
if (parts.length < 5) return null; // Ensure event has start & end time
